inn1.comm: starts off with a yorker on off stump, the batsman digs it out to the off side
another fuller delivery attempted but this is just a perfect half-volley, the batsman creams it through cover point for a boundary

this is an early strike here, catches the batsman plumb in front! Abbott fires another fuller delivery and Mazakazda doesn't lean into it, tries to push it to cover. This one comes in a touch and beats the inside edge to hit him right in front of off and middle. Poor technique there by the batsman. Not much doubt there was the umpire, the bat was miles away from the ball
he looks to leave this fuller delivery but is a touch too late, the ball hits the bat before rolling towards second slip
hops on the crease and tucks the back of length delivery to square leg
short of length on off, the batsman gets on the back foot to defend it to the off side

this is too easy for de Lange, what is all the fuss about! He gets the wicket off his first ball - Mutumbami had no chance there. Short of length just over off stump, climbing on the batsman and moving just a touch away, enough to catch the shoulder of the bat and deflect to second slip.
lots of bounce there for de Lange, the batsman stays away from the line of this one
that is quick! this is being taken by QdK near his face.. Serious stuff here
how did he survive that! Superb delivery, on a length around off stump.. The batsman was on the back foot.. it swings away, squares up the batsman and the edges flies to third man
just outside off, the batsman pulls his bat in just in time to avoid the delivery
he is making them hop about the crease. Another short of length delivery, flies to the keeper
length delivery wide outside off, the batsman has no trouble in leaving that alone
drives at this fuller delivery from the crease, gets a thick outside edge to third man
on the pads and this has been flicked over midwicket. Hmm. Not sure if he entirely meant to play that shot
goes deep in the crease and pushes it to wide mid-off for a quick single
this one cuts in from a length, the batsman gets an inside edge down to fine leg as he looks to defend
superb delivery! The batsman leaves it alone but it was not too far from off. Fuller and angled in.
this is good pace! The batsman are hopping about in the crease but not getting anywhere close to the line.. This flies past the outside edge
fuller and on off, the batsman was stuck in the crease but somehow manages to keep it out
he is hanging his bat now! It's full and wide outside off, beats the outside edge
he comes a touch forward and manages to guide this length ball down to third man
he ducks under just in time! This is some test.. Quick quick bouncer there
he has managed to find the gap at cover but wasn't the most convincing shot! Stuck in the crease, he gets a full one and hammers it through off.
nicely played this time! He comes forward and pushes the length ball through extra cover for a couple
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman's front foot goes away from the line but he manages to punch it straight to cover
stays in the crease and steers the length delivery to backward point
that's the shot of the day so far! Chigumbura arches back and whacks the short ball over midwicket, hammered through
he gets an inside edge to the leg side as he looks to defend, scampers through for a quick one
now Raza wants to play a pull but he is into it too early, it hits the bottom of the bat and rolls to the off side
more pace from the bowler! This is a searing bouncer, takes off from a pitch that is supposed to be slow.. Way over the batsman's head
he is stuck in the crease, thinking about that bouncer.. he plays inside the line of this short of a length ball and is beaten
now the yorker! Chigumbura digs it out to mid-off for a quick single
plays the length delivery from the back foot, defends it towards backward point
straight on the off stump line, Raza defends it down the pitch off the back foot
another short of length delivery on the stumps, this time he defends it to the off side
superbly played! Either he spotted it early or it was a touch slower.. Raza stays back, arches backward and hammers the short of length delivery over cover for a boundary
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends to cover
goes for a poke at this wider length delivery but he is not making that movement towards the ball, gets beaten
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman comes forward to defend the length ball. Probably hit the pad first.. Too close actually. I can't even make that out in the replays
comes forward and opens the face of the bat to run this down to third man
he stays on the back foot and dabs the back of length delivery to cover
nicely played! He stays on the back foot and punches it square on the off side but he is not able to beat the point fielder
good teasing delivery and it is superbly handled! He comes forward and just times it through cover..It has enough legs on it to beat the fielders
here comes the shorter delivery and floors him without touching him. Chigumbura falls backwards as he tries to get away from the line
and down on the floor again as de Lange targets his head. QdK finds it funny form behind the stumps
back of length on the stumps, this time he stays upright and defends it down the pitch
and down again! He has issues with his balance as he ducks under this
on the back foot and tucked to square leg
he stays on the back foot and punches this beautifully through cover point! After de Lange, Abbott must be seeming like a spinner to them
short of length and on the pads, it's clipped off the thigh pad fine down the leg side.. Two boundaries in two.
on the back foot he goes and whips this through square leg for a single
this looked like a slower ball, the batsman was stuck in the crease but manages to steer it down to third man
he shuffles across and tries to punch the back of length delivery through to the leg side, gets rapped on the thigh pad
no feet movement but who cares.. Raza has hammered this length delivery over cover.. Not the best strategy, but it gives him four runs
he sways away from the line of yet another bouncer.. stays on his feet this time
gets good shape on a length delivery outside off.. The batsman think about poking at it but pulls his bat back
this one is taking off everytime from short of length.. The batsman pokes at it and is lucky not to get a touch
this is outside off but Chigumbura drops his wrists early.. He is expecting every delivery to be a bouncer
short ball again, this time he ducks under it
back of length on off, the batsman dabs it past backward point for a single
on the pads, the batsman misses his flick but picks up a single for a leg bye
that has been picked from well outside off and murdered over mid-on! That brings the 50 of the stand too. Courageous shot there.

now this is a poor shot! He has been playing the pull shot with comfort and therefore, Faf had placed a deep square leg. He gets a short ball that comes a touch slow of the surface, Raza goes for the pull but drags that a touch too square. I get a feeling he was trying to target that mid-on area again, but this settles comfortably in the hands of Phangiso in the deep. That's a bonus wicket, blame it on Jacques
angled away from the lefty, the batsman comes forward and leaves it alone
this would have been a good delivery to the right-hander, but down the leg side for a lefty
he stays in the crease and defends the length ball solidly to off
rock solid behind that one, pushes it down to third man for a single
length delivery outside off, Williams defends it to the off side
he gets behind the line of this short of length delivery and defends it solidly to cover
he comes forward and pushes the length delivery to cover
stays back to a fuller delivery and gets into a tangle, but defends it to the off side in the end. He closed the face of the bat too early. Sign of the slowness of the pitch actually
he leans into this punch and drives it on the up to deep cover
angled it across the right-hander, the batsman leaves it alone
length delivery on off, the batsman defends it easily to cover
he leans forward and pushes the length delivery to deep cover for an easy single
extremely well placed! It is full and wide and could have been hit anywhere, but Chigumbura waits a touch and squeezes it past backward point for another boundary
here comes the short ball from wide of the crease! the batsman sways away from the line
slower delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends it to point
he comes forward and dabs it to the off side but the point fielder is quick to get to it
length delivery outside off, the batsman defends it to the off side easily
fuller and wider outside off, the batsman comes forward and punches it to short cover
he comes forward and steers the length delivery down to third man
targets the stumps with a fuller delivery, the batsman pushes it to mid-on
angled across the right-hander and since there is no movement on this, easily left alone
quick delivery this time! Takes off from a short of length, the batsman ducks under it
length delivery on off, punched to cover off the front foot
nicely punches to deep cover off the front foot. He is looking like a class apart at the moment
looks to whip this short of length delivery to the leg side but gets a leading edge down the pitch
short of length outside off, he arches back and cuts it over backward point for a single.. That lands close to the third-man fielder
he comes forward and defends the length ball to the off side
too straight this time, the batsman works it away through square leg for a quick single
first loose shot from the batsman as he punches at one away from his body, it moves a touch too to beat the outside edge
follows up the poor shot with a superb one, leans into the drive and picks up a couple to deep extra cover
it's full on the off stump but the batsman whips it to deep midwicket with a wristy flick
looks to nudge the short of length delivery to the leg side but gets hit on the thigh pad
back of length and on the stumps, easily defended down the pitch
he stays in the crease and defends the back of length delivery to the leg side
fuller and on off stump, Williams whips it to deep midwicket for a single
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman leans into this and drives it to deep cover
fuller delivery outside off, the batsman defends it down the pitch off the front foot
he comes forward and punches it to backward point
some extra room on this one, Williams has been looking very neat, leans forward and drives it to deep extra cover
decent areas from Shezi. The batsman guides the fuller delivery straight to point
length delivery outside off, the batsman defends it to the leg side
full and wide, he flays his bat at this and slices it over cover point for a single to the deep
back of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman arches back and sways away from the line
on the pads, the batsman gets hit on the thigh pad but swaps strike as the ball rolls in the open space
short delivery this time, the batsman is able to hook it down to deep backward square leg but he was out of the comfort zone.. took his eyes off there
he comes forward and pushes this through cover for yet another single
much slower from the bowler this time, the batsman has to wait before dabbing it towards cover
he is in trouble briefly as he takes off for a single with a dab to midwicket, but the fielder gets there and fires a throw at the stumps.. misses.
looks to cut a short of length delivery but is beaten by the lack of bounce on it, makes no connection
a slower delivery wide outside off, the batsman chops it fine on the off side for a single
comes forward too early and tries to turn it away to the leg side, but gets an inside edge on to his pads
fuller, the batsman drives it forcefully to mid off
breaks the spell of singles and dots with a boundary down the ground. Loud grunt of disappointed from the bowler.. He didn't mean to bowl that high full toss on off
length delivery, pushed to deep cover easily for a single
he comes forward and punches the length delivery down to mid off
he comes solidly behind the length delivery and punches it to cover
fuller delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and punches it to cover where the fielder is not able to make a clean stop.. the batsmen however decide against taking a single
fuller on the stumps, the batsman whips it behind square leg for a quick couple
length delivery just outside off, defended to the off side
more solid defence from the batsman as he pushes this to cover
he pushes at this length delivery a touch away from his body, gets an inside edge to the leg side
keeps it tight on off stump, the batsman can only defend it to short midwicket
back of length delivery, Williams stays in the crease and clips it to deep square leg for a single
keeps it nice and straight, the batsman punches it to cover
down the pitch, and drags this from wide outside off down to long-on
tossed up nicely onto off stump, and it's driven back to the bowler
goes back to this one. It isn't too short, and it goes with the angle, and he manages to punch it back to the bowler
slower now, and he comes forward and plays a checked drive into the covers
bowed 'im! He was looking to sweep that from outside off, and the ball turned in, beat his bat and crashed into off stump. Bit of an inside-edge, maybe
comes forward and defends the tossed up delivery to the off side
fuller and slower on the pads, the batsman misses his flick and gets hit on the pads
length delivery outside off, comes slow of the pitch and messes with the batsman's timing as he looks to push it to off
appeal for lbw as the batsman gets hit in front of leg stump, but that looked like it pitched outside leg..Yeah.. well outside leg stump line
straight and on off stump line, Chigumbura defends it to off
he keeps playing defensive shots, this one is off a slower delivery, played to point
hits the pads again and completes a maiden. No way out of this jail for Chigumbura
tossed up and slow on off, the batsman defends it to cover
slower and on the stumps, the batsman punches it to cover off the back foot
tossed up on the middle and leg line, the batsman comes forward to defend, gets an outside edge to backward point
he pushes this tossed up delivery straight to cover
he still can't find a way past that cover fielder! This one was played off the back foot. Du Plessis cuts it off again
slower and flighted, the batsman can only nudges it to point
first runs for Chigumbura in a while as he whips this fuller delivery to deep midwicket
on a length and around off stump, not much Waller can do except defend it down the pitch
fuller and wider outside off, the batsman is not going to chase it with a slip in place. The umpire stretches his arms at that one.. a very very harsh call I say. Shezi is flabbergasted
fuller delivery on the stumps, he defends it down the pitch
this comes in a touch after pitching on short of length, surprises the batsman as he defends
he comes forward and defends this length delivery to the leg side
flays his bat at this angled delivery but misses, plays inside the line
he uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball but drives it back to the bowler
tossed up on the middle and leg line, the batsman defends
slow and tossed up on the pads, the batsman nudges it to square leg
goes deep in his crease but still can't buy a run, punches it straight to short midwicket
full and flighted, going down the leg side too, the batsman gets a tickle on that and runs for a quick couple
marginally short, allows the batsman to go back and punch it firmly to deep extra cover
bowls it full and on the stumps, the batsman is able to clip it to deep square leg for a single
short of length on the body, the batsman takes his bottom hand off the bat as he fends it to square leg, takes a single
here comes the short ball that has tested Chigumbura all day.. He ducks under it but is off balance again
he looks to push this length ball through cover but gets an inside edge down the pitch
strays down the leg side as he strives too hard
that is some shot after taking all that pounding! He comes forward and drives the fuller delivery straight down the ground, past the stumps at the other end.. Beautifully hit.. Brings the team's 100
short ball, he ducks under it again, but this is too high
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to off
he rocks back and punches the flatter delivery to deep cover for a single
slower and tossed up on off, the batsman pushes it to cover point
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to midwicket
steps out but this is heading down the leg side and he does well to get some pad on it
he comes forward and pushes the length delivery to Faf at cover
goes back to one he probably shouldn't have, defends it to cover
that was in the air for a bit! The batsman pushes this short of length delivery in the air, but just drops short of backward point
back of length but heading down the leg side again

he picks up yet another wicket! It was heading down the leg side and initially looked like it was off the thigh pad.. QdK was the only one who appealed but it looked like a normal keeper's appeal - to prevent the wide call. The umpire though raised the finger after a few seconds. Replays show the ball did come off the gloves there. Strange one there as I thought de Lange was least interested in that. It looks like that the batsman had started walking there..
more short stuff from the bowler, gets the batsman hopping and ducking at the same time..A hopping duck.. Sorry, but do the ducks hop?
another short ball, this one is well over the batsman
short of length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it off the back foot
stays on the back foot and defends this length delivery down the pitch
back of length on the off, the batsman defends it easily
tossed up on off, the batsman goes back and punches it through cover
he steps out of the crease and defends it down the pitch
uses his feet again to reach the pitch of the delivery, defends
comes down the pitch and drives the flighted delivery to long off
tossed up on the stumps, now the capitano uses his feet to ease this to long on
comes down the pitch and drives it through midwicket for a single
length delivery just outside off, the batsman defends it off the back foot
bowls length on the stumps, the batsman nudges it straight to square leg
more short stuff from SA bowlers.. the batsman ducks under it
this one comes in from wide of the crease, the batsman gets cramped as he defends
stays on the back foot and nudges this length delivery to point

another one goes down! Jonwe shuffles across the crease and comes right in front of the line of the ball, gets hit high on the back pad and that would have crashed on the top of leg. Easy decision for the umpire
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it off the back foot
comes down the pitch and drives this flighted delivery down to long off
wider this time, crunched to deep cover off the back foot
takes a step out and punches this back to the bowler
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
goes deep in his crease and punches it firmly to deep cover for a single
length delivery on the off stump line, the batsman guides it down to third man for a single
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it back to the bowler
fuller and on the pads, Proper flicks it to fine leg
he comes forward and defends this fuller delivery solidly down the pitch
he waits on the back foot and defends the back of length delivery to off
comes forward and defends the length ball solidly to off
more defence from the batsman, dabs it to off
he has fallen over to the off side to see his leg stump flattened! This was full and targetted at that leg stump, and Prosper went too far across.

Nyumbu comes Nyumbu goes! That was a sharp shot ball from Parney and there was no time for the batsman to get away.. He takes his eyes off and fends, the ball takes the glove and lobs up for the point fielder
poor delivery this time. It's short of length and down the leg side, the batsman gets some bat on it and collects four
good short ball this time, the batsman somehow gets away from the line
looks for a yorker but the batsman is able to squeeze it out to third man

appeal for lbw and now Kamungozi has to go.. This is on a length and swung back into the batsman, who was down the wicket too.. That pitched outside leg.. Shezi won't care - he has his first international wicket.
back of length delivery, the batsman defends it to the leg side
fires a yorker on the toes, the batsman is able to dig it out
short delivery.. doesn't have much sting but enough to test the No. 11.. the batsman sways out of line
length delivery on the pads, the batsman is able to take a leg bye to give El Elton the strike
looks to drive this fuller delivery through off but gets an inside edge to the pads
looks to slap this length delivery down the ground but finds the man at mid off
fires a yorker, but this is a low full toss that is whipped through midwicket for a couple. It brings El Capitano's 16th ODI fifty..An important one here
short delivery down the leg side, the batsman ducks under it
waits on the back foot and guides the back of length ball through backward point for a couple
he tickles this full delivery to midwicket and calls for a quick single
fires another one on the blockhole, the batsman punches it straight to mid on
short ball, but this is down the leg side
aims it at the blockhole but El Elton moves his front leg out and hammers it down the ground, beats mid-on to get past Spike's psychological mark
short and wide outside off, the batsman flat-bats it straight to mid on
superb shot! This is baseball hit. He stands tall, waits for the shorter and slower delivery, then whacks it over mid off
this one goes over point.. the shot remains the same.. Clear your front leg out and flat bat it.. The point fielder has to chase it and he keeps it in
he comes forward and defends it solidly to loud cheers from the crowd
fires this one in the blockhole, the batsman brings his bat down and inside edges it to the keeper
fires it on the toes, but a touch too far.. down the leg side
short, in the zone, this has been hammered over midwicket with a powerful mow. It's a flat hit.. Well done Elton
woohoo! he keeps firing.. It's full and in the slot, the batsman goes for a golf swing over the cow corner, one bounce for four. Superb hitting
looks to blast this down the ground but doesn't get timing, the fielder cuts it out
attempts the bouncer but this is too short, Elton watches it go over his head
they continue to spray it all over, this is down the leg side
length delivery, he dabs it in front and calls for a quick single
but this is down the leg side.. Could have gone for a boundary, but QdK dives to his left to cut it off
short ball outside off, easily left alone
fires this at the base of the stumps, the batsman jams his bat at it.. Checks the toe of the bat to see if it's ok
no no no.. that's no the right length.. In the slot, Elton whacks it high and long over the sight screen.
more sixes! short, slow, hit-me-baby-one-more-time- length.. The batsman clears his front leg and whacks it over deep midwicket, down into the trees..
fuller and on the stumps, he drives it firmly down to long on
bowls a low full toss that is punched straight down to mid-off
bowls it full and wide outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
fires a low full toss on the stumps, the batsman whips it straight to midwicket
what a shot! This is on a length outside off, he clears his front leg and hammers it through extra cover ..Let it snow let it snow
good yorker this time, the batsman can't do much about this, digs it out down the pitch
fuller and on the stumps, he hits it to midwicket but doesn't want the single

slower delivery does the job! The batsman was looking for the long on area but plays the shot too early. He had exposed the stumps anyway and that hits the top of the middle. No hundred for Chigumbura

inn2.comm: it's slashed hard off the front foot but cannot beat the fielder at point
draws him into the big drive with a wide and full delivery, but this changes direction just enough to beat the outside edge
he shuffles across and clips the length delivery down to fine leg to get off the mark

he could be gone! He could be gone here. This is suicidal from Rossouw. He dabs this length delivery to mid-off and sets off immediately. The fielder gets to the ball quickly and releases it with one quick wrist action to hit the stumps direct. This is one story he wouldn't want to tell his grandkids.. Maybe he will .. Great work though by Waller. Rossouw would be gutted..
shuffles across and pushes the length ball to mid-on
he comes forward and steers the length ball down to third man for a single
angled in too much, it slips down the leg side
serious issues with his direction here as he pushes another one down the leg side
it's hat-trick, it's a hat-trick of wides.. Down the leg side... far down the leg side
gets his radar right and serves it on a length on off, de Kock defends it off the front foot
back of length on the pads, the batsman pulls it down to fine leg for a single
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends
back of length on the stumps, Faf looks to tuck it to the leg side but gets a leading edge down the pitch
another one on the line of stumps, the batsman defends it solidy
wider outside off, the batsman comes forward and leaves it alone
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and defends to cover
leans into the length ball and punches it to off, finds the cover fielder
that is wonderfully hit through the line! He comes forward and punches it on the up, through extra cover
back of length on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the leg side
length delivery wide outside, the batsman looks to whack it but gets a big outside edge to the third man boundary
he repeats the shot he played earlier in the over, comes forward and punches the length delivery on the up and through that tiny gap at extra cover
fuller and on the pads, Faf gets off the mark with a wristy flick that races through square leg
length ball again, but this is too straight, nudged through square leg for a single again
fuller and on off, de Kock drives this down the ground to mid-off
back of length delivery, de Kock dabs it to the leg side and calls early for a quick single
another dab, another single, Faf waits in the crease and pushes it down to third man
he bowls it full on the middle stump line, not according to that field, whipped away to deep midwicket
floats it up to the stumps from round the wicket, the batsman drives it to extra cover
on a length around off and middle, the batsman comes forward and defends it down the pitch
lots of width on this one, de Kock comes forward and crashes it but hits it straight to that fielder at short cover point
slower delivery on the pads, it is clipped to deep backward square leg for a single
length delivery around off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly
comes forward and punches the fuller delivery straight to mid off
bowls it full on off, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
flighted on the middle and leg line, easily whipped through midwicket for a single
tosses it up outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover
slower this time and it's through the infield. Faf comes forward and drives it inside out, along the ground.. Beats the man at cover and then there is no one to stop it
"catch it" is the call as Faf comes down the pitch and chips it over, but that evades the leaping fielder at mid on
flatter and quicker on off, the batsman stands tall and punches it to cover
bowls short of length from round the stumps, de Kock drags it to short midwicket
pushes it further up this time, the batsman comes forward and punches it to mid on
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to the left of midwicket fielder for a quick single
fuller delivery outside off, Faf comes forward and punches it to mid-off firmly
short and the batsman was ready for it, kind of flicks/pulls it towards deep backward square leg as there is no pace on it.. The fine-leg fielder runs around and keeps that in
this is authoritative! Stands tall on his toes and punches the back of length delivery through cover.. Just timing on that one
he comes forward and works it with the turn (there isn't much franky)  to deep midwicket
this is superb now! Too full and flighted, he also knows that there is no turn... he stretches forward and drives it over mid-off for a well-controlled hit
now goes back and punches the flatter delivery through cover, all along the ground, brings up the fifty of the team
slower and outside off, the batsman punches it to long off for a single
he works it away to deep midwicket for yet another single
keep them coming! This is wide and short from Faffie (thanks Stiaan).. and Faf arches back and whacks it over cover for four more
they want to finish this in a hurry! De Kock steps out and whack the length ball across the line.. gets more height than length and picks up a couple to deep midwicket
length delivery on the middle stump line, he nurdles it to deep midwicket for a single
the bowler has overstepped but check this shot out! He comes forward and whips the length delivery through wide mid-on.. wrist, timing, and a whole lot of love behind that shot.
and he can only hit it as far as short cover! The batsman charged down the pitch, almost yorked himself but Hamilton keeps it in
an overthrow is given as Sikandar Raza flicks the ball towards the non-striker's, no one was backing up. The batsmen weren't going anywhere originally
length delivery outside off, the batsman pushes it through the gap at cover for a single
length delivery on the stumps, Faf punches it back to the bowler, who in turn throws it towards the stumps and hits the batsman.. apologises
flatter delivery, the batsman defends it down the pitch
comes down the pitch and hammers the tossed up delivery over wide mid-on for a couple of runs, didn't get too much timing on that but that went in the gap
leans forward and pushes the floater to the right of midwicket for an easy single
flatter and shorter outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it to mid off
tossed up outside off, the batsman nudges it to midwicket with the turn
flatter and quicker outside off, punched straight to extra cover
tossed up on off and de Kock pulls out the reverse sweep.. times it very well but Nyumu at short third man dives to his left and cuts it off
flatter outside off, cuts it straight to backward point
allows it to come in with the turn, nudges it to deep square leg for a single
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
he goes deep in the crease and punches it down to mid-on, no runs there
stays back and punches the shorter delivery straight to cover
pushed towards long-off for a single
jumps down the track and eases the ball towards mid-on for a single
goes for a slog sweep, but top edges it, initial worry for de Kock was that the ball would loop to the keeper, but he had enough on it for the ball to land way beyond the keeper
towards midwicket for a single
chopped towards point off the front foot
full and on the pads, whipped to backward square leg, a loud shout of 'No,' from Faf lets QdK know there is no single

bowled 'im! through the gap, between bat and pad, middle stump is on the ground, zips through after pitching, Faf was expecting it to turn away, it doesn't and goes straight on, Zimbabwe have their second wicket
moves across and defends his first delivery
gets behind the line of this one and defends
a touch short, outside off, slapped towards point
solid forward defensive, gets a good stride in
spinning down the leg side, Duminy gets deep in the crease and tucks the ball to the leg side
tossed up and slower on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
flatter on the pads, defended to midwicket
now he steps out, now he sends it over the boundary. De Kock's weight was on that shot as he made the contact, whacks it into the trees behind long on
flatter delivery on the stumps, defended to the off side
comes out of the crease but it's too early, chops it to point
tossed up on the leg stump line, he misses the flick and gets hit on the pads
comes round the stumps, the batsman drives it firmly to cover, who is not able to stop it cleanly, allows the run
looks to drag a flighted delivery from outside off, but this beats the bat and keeps turning away
tossed up on the middle and leg line, turns away, the batsman pushes it to cover
he comes forward and drives the flighted delivery to long off
he comes forward and drives the tossed up delivery to cover
more air this time, JP punches it to cover
he goes down on his knees and slogs across the line for a single to deep midwicket
flighted on the pads, the batsman sweeps it down to deep backward square leg for a couple
flatter this time, he goes back and punches it to long off for a single
this is good running! De Kock pushes it to midwicket and starts strolling for a single, then realises the fielder is deep and increases the speed, makes it two comfortably
nudges this to square leg for another easy single
flat, short and wide, all JP can do is to hit it straight to cover
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman caresses it to long on for another single
he comes forward and pushes the flighted delivery to cover
flatter and quicker on the stumps, JP punches it down to the bowler
much slower this time, JP stretches forward and smothers the spin on that one
gets some turn from middle stump, enough to get the outside edge of the bat as JP looks to defend, it rolls to point
he comes forward and punches it to mid-off
he angles this one in but this is down the leg side. It wasn't too far from the bat though
doesn't change a thing! The batsman goes for the pull but this is well down the leg side
finally gets it on target, the batsman clips it to deep midwicket calmly to pick up a single
angles it across the right-hander, who comes forward before stylishly leaving this alone
solid defence off the front foot.. it's so straight that it hits the middle stump at the non-striker's end
short of length outside off, the batsman chops it straight to backward point
he comes forward and punches the length delivery down to mid on
fuller delivery, he comes forward and drives it straight to cover
he is getting some turn, but QdK covers for it comfortably as he defends it down the pitch
flatter and down the leg side, the batsman clips it past short fine leg for a single
flighted delivery on the stumps, JP gets off the strike with a neat push to long off
flighted on off stump line, de Kock flashes his bat at it, hits it straight to cover through
tossed up on the stumps, he whips it against the turn to pick up a couple to deep midwicket
flighted delivery on off, punched to long off for a single
length delivery outside off, the batsman cracks it to deep point off the front foot
allows the ball to come on him before nudging it straight to midwicket
comes forward and punches the length ball straight down the pitch for a single to mid off
looks to punch the short of length delivery through the off, but gets a big inside edge on to his pads
he gets to his half-century with lofted shot over mid-off! Comes down the pitch, moves to the leg side and just chips it over easily.. SA past 100.. QdK avg over 50 too
he works it to deep midwicket from outside off with a wristy flick
lots of air on this one! But look at that.. QdK hammers it through cover.. he cleared his front leg out to get the placement a bit squarish.. no one moved..
stays on the back foot and punches it to deep extra cover for a couple more
ok he wants to go home early! This is tossed up outside off and de Kock and hammers it over wide long on for another boundary
he comes forward and whips it from outside off to wide long on, along the ground, and calls for a quick couple
pushes this softly towards mid-on for a single
he stays back and nudges it to square leg for a single
looks to punch the length delivery through off but gets an underedge to the keeper
crunched off the front foot through cover! That made a cracking sound as he leant on this length delivery, picks up a couple to deep extra cover
tucks it to square leg for a single to give QdK the strike
he moves to the leg side and whacks the low full toss down the ground.. mid-off had no chance.. That is also the 50 of the partnership
short of length on the stumps, he works it away to deep midwicket for a single
he shuffles across and whips the length delivery straight to midwicket
he is running away with it! Comes down the pitch and whacks it over midwicket for another boundary. And this is a slow pitch, he is countering it well with moving down so early
full and flighted outside off, it's dragged down to long on for a single
cute little reverse paddle brings a couple for JP..This is all too easy
flatter and on the stumps, JP goes right back and defends it down the pitch
he leans forward and realising that he not to the pitch, defends
comes down the pitch and creams the fuller delivery to long on
he comes forward and drives the length delivery on the up, straight to cover
leans forward and punches it through the infield to deep cover
he heaves at it across the line, gets it off the inside half of his bat but still picks up a couple to deep midwicket

oh this is special! He comes down the pitch, and the ball comes in a touch slow, sits up right in front.. The batsman just goes through with his shot and hammers it over long off.. such supreme timing there

whack! slapped straight to the fielder! Oh Quinton..He came down the pitch and was looking for another six, but hits it flat and hard. QdK gets it off the middle of the bat but hits it straight to the fielder at deep midwicket.. the lone fielder.. a metre here, a metre there and that could have been one of the flattest sixes of the millenium.. His record keeps on getting worse.. five hundreds.. two fifties now.. that's bad... that's too bad
comes forward and punches the length delivery straight to cover
tossed up on the stumps, JP comes forward and defends
he goes deep in the crease and punches the length ball down to long off
comes forward and pushes the flighted delivery to cover
slightly strays to the leg side, the batsman sweeps it to deep square leg to get off the mark
goes deep in the crease and nudges the flatter delivery to deep midwicket
superb shot! he rocks back and cuts it very hard past the point fielder. Given all his reputation as a six-hitter, I find Miller one of the better all-round new left-handed batsmen around
tossed up really high and full, the batsman pushes it to wide long on for a couple
he comes forward and eases it to long off for a single
flatter this time, Miller goes back and works it away to that gap at wide long on to pick up another couple
fuller and quicker on the pads, the batsman nudges it straight to square leg
goes deep in the crease and punches this to deep midwicket for a single
another one nudges through midwicket for a single
he rocks back and cuts it hard towards cover, where the fielder makes a half-stop.. allows a single
down the leg side and all the batsman has to do is to paddle it fine and beat the short fine leg fielder.. very nicely played there..doesn't try to hit it too hard
short and wide, the batsman wants to cream it through the infield but can't beat cover
goes on the back foot and punches this flatter delivery straight to midwicket
tossed up, but down the leg side, the batsman paddles it fine again.. but this doesn't go too far
can't trust anybody these days..! They score just seven off the over.. JP punches this to long off calmly
stays in the crease and punches it to cover
comes down the pitch and whips it over midwicket for a sweetly-timed six! Could have done the same in the last over..
